homepage.description: Url of the homepage of the package.
homepage.title: Homepage

repository.description: Url that points to where the source code is hosted e.g. (github.com)
repository.title: Repository

documentation.description: Url that points to where the documentation is hosted.
documentation.title: Documentation

license_file.description: Paths to the license files of this package.
license_file.title: License File

license_url.description: A url that points to the license file.
license_url.title: License Url

summary.description: A short description of the package.
summary.title: Summary

description.description: Extented description of the package or a file (usually a README).
description.title: Description

number.description: Build number to version current build in addition to package version
number.title: Number

string.description: Build string to identify build variant (if not explicitly set, computed automatically from used build variant)
string.title: String

skip.description: List of conditions under which to skip the build of the package.
skip.title: Skip

script.description: Build script to be used. If not given, tries to find 'build.sh' on Unix or 'bld.bat' on Windows inside the recipe folder.
script.title: Script

noarch.description: Can be either 'generic' or 'python'. A noarch 'python' package compiles .pyc files upon installation.
noarch.title: Noarch

entry_points.description: Only valid if `noarch: python` - list of all entry points of the package. e.g. `bsdiff4 = bsdiff4.cli:main_bsdiff4`
entry_points.title: Entry Points

run_exports.description: Additional `run` dependencies added to a package that is build against this package.
run_exports.title: Run Exports

ignore_run_exports.description: Ignore specific `run` dependencies that are added by dependencies in our `host` requirements section that have`run_exports`.
ignore_run_exports.title: Ignore Run Exports

ignore_run_exports_from.description: Ignore `run_exports` from the specified dependencies in our `host` section.`
ignore_run_exports_from.title: Ignore Run Exports From

track_features.description: deprecated, but still used to downweigh packages
track_features.title: Track Features

include_recipe.description: Whether or not to include the rendered recipe in the final package.
include_recipe.title: Include Recipe

pre-link.description: Script to execute when installing - before linking. Highly discouraged!
pre-link.title: Pre-Link

post-link.description: Script to execute when installing - after linking.
post-link.title: Post-Link

pre-unlink.description: Script to execute when removing - before unlinking.
pre-unlink.title: Pre-Unlink

no_link.description: A list of files that are included in the package but should not be installed when installing the package.
no_link.title: No Link

binary_relocation.description: A list of files that should be excluded from binary relocation or False to ignore all binary files.
binary_relocation.title: Binary Relocation

has_prefix_files.description: A list of files to force being detected as A TEXT file for prefix replacement.
has_prefix_files.title: Has Prefix Files

binary_has_prefix_files.description: A list of files to force being detected as A BINARY file for prefix replacement.
binary_has_prefix_files.title: Binary Has Prefix Files

ignore_prefix_files.description: A list of files that are not considered for prefix replacement, or True to ignore all files.
ignore_prefix_files.title: Ignore Prefix Files

detect_binary_files_with_prefix.description: Wether to detect binary files with prefix or not. Defaults to True on Unix and False on Windows.
detect_binary_files_with_prefix.title: Detect Binary Files With Prefix

skip_compile_pyc.description: A list of python files that should not be compiled to .pyc files at install time.
skip_compile_pyc.title: Skip Compile Pyc

script_env.description: Environment variables to either pass through to the script environment or set.

always_include_files.description: Files to be included even if they are present in the PREFIX before building.
always_include_files.title: Always Include Files

script.description: A script to run to perform the test.
script.title: Script

extra_requirements.description: Additional dependencies to install before running the test.

files.description: Additional files to include for the test.

name.description: The recipe name, this is only used to identify the name of the recipe.
name.title: Name

version.description: The version of each output, this can be overwritten per output
version.title: Version

context.description: Defines arbitrary key-value pairs for Jinja interpolation
context.title: Context

source.description: The source items to be downloaded and used for the build.
source.title: Source

build.description: Describes how the package should be build.

about.description: A human readable description of the package information

extra.description: An set of arbitrary values that are included in the package manifest
extra.title: Extra

outputs.description: A list of outputs that are generated for this recipe.
outputs.title: Outputs

file.description: Path in the source directory that contains the packages description. E.g. README.md
file.title: File

downstream.description: Install the package and use the output of this package to test if the tests in the downstream package still succeed.
downstream.title: Downstream

patches.description: A list of patches to apply after fetching the source
patches.title: Patches

folder.description: The location in the working directory to place the source
folder.title: Folder

git_url.description: The url that points to the git repository.
git_url.title: Git Url

git_depth.description: A value to use when shallow cloning the repository.
git_depth.title: Git Depth

lfs.description: Whether or not to use git-lfs when cloning the repository.
lfs.title: Lfs

imports.description: A list of Python imports to check after having installed the built package.
imports.title: Imports

patches.description: A list of patches to apply after fetching the source
patches.title: Patches

folder.description: The location in the working directory to place the source
folder.title: Folder

path.description: A path on the local machine that contains the source.
path.title: Path

use_gitignore.description: Whether or not to use the .gitignore file when copying the source.
use_gitignore.title: Use Gitignore

package.description: The package name and version, this overwrites any top-level fields.

source.description: The source items to be downloaded and used for the build.
source.title: Source

build.description: Describes how the package should be build.

about.description: A human readable description of the package information. The values here are merged with the top level `about` field.

extra.description: An set of arbitrary values that are included in the package manifest. The values here are merged with the top level `extras` field.
extra.title: Extra

number.description: Build number to version current build in addition to package version
number.title: Number

string.description: Build string to identify build variant (if not explicitly set, computed automatically from used build variant)
string.title: String

skip.description: List of conditions under which to skip the build of the package.
skip.title: Skip

script.description: Build script to be used. If not given, tries to find 'build.sh' on Unix or 'bld.bat' on Windows inside the recipe folder.
script.title: Script

noarch.description: Can be either 'generic' or 'python'. A noarch 'python' package compiles .pyc files upon installation.
noarch.title: Noarch

entry_points.description: Only valid if `noarch: python` - list of all entry points of the package. e.g. `bsdiff4 = bsdiff4.cli:main_bsdiff4`
entry_points.title: Entry Points

run_exports.description: Additional `run` dependencies added to a package that is build against this package.
run_exports.title: Run Exports

ignore_run_exports.description: Ignore specific `run` dependencies that are added by dependencies in our `host` requirements section that have`run_exports`.
ignore_run_exports.title: Ignore Run Exports

ignore_run_exports_from.description: Ignore `run_exports` from the specified dependencies in our `host` section.`
ignore_run_exports_from.title: Ignore Run Exports From

track_features.description: deprecated, but still used to downweigh packages
track_features.title: Track Features

include_recipe.description: Whether or not to include the rendered recipe in the final package.
include_recipe.title: Include Recipe

pre-link.description: Script to execute when installing - before linking. Highly discouraged!
pre-link.title: Pre-Link

post-link.description: Script to execute when installing - after linking.
post-link.title: Post-Link

pre-unlink.description: Script to execute when removing - before unlinking.
pre-unlink.title: Pre-Unlink

no_link.description: A list of files that are included in the package but should not be installed when installing the package.
no_link.title: No Link

binary_relocation.description: A list of files that should be excluded from binary relocation or False to ignore all binary files.
binary_relocation.title: Binary Relocation

has_prefix_files.description: A list of files to force being detected as A TEXT file for prefix replacement.
has_prefix_files.title: Has Prefix Files

binary_has_prefix_files.description: A list of files to force being detected as A BINARY file for prefix replacement.
binary_has_prefix_files.title: Binary Has Prefix Files

ignore_prefix_files.description: A list of files that are not considered for prefix replacement, or True to ignore all files.
ignore_prefix_files.title: Ignore Prefix Files

detect_binary_files_with_prefix.description: Wether to detect binary files with prefix or not. Defaults to True on Unix and False on Windows.
detect_binary_files_with_prefix.title: Detect Binary Files With Prefix

skip_compile_pyc.description: A list of python files that should not be compiled to .pyc files at install time.
skip_compile_pyc.title: Skip Compile Pyc

script_env.description: Environment variables to either pass through to the script environment or set.

always_include_files.description: Files to be included even if they are present in the PREFIX before building.
always_include_files.title: Always Include Files

cache_only.description: Do not output a package but use this output as an input to others.
cache_only.title: Cache Only

cache_from.description: Take the output of the specified outputs and copy them in the working directory.
cache_from.title: Cache From

build.description: Dependencies to install on the build platform architecture. Compilers, CMake, everything that needs to execute at build time.
build.title: Build

host.description: Dependencies to install on the host platform architecture. All the packages that your build links against.
host.title: Host

run.description: Dependencies that should be installed alongside this package. Dependencies in the `host` section with `run_exports` are also automatically added here.
run.title: Run

weak.description: Weak run exports apply from the host env to the run env
weak.title: Weak

strong.description: Strong run exports apply from the build and host env to the run env
strong.title: Strong

noarch.description: Noarch run exports are the only ones looked at when building noarch packages
noarch.title: Noarch

weak_constrains.description: Weak run constrains add run_constrains from the host env
weak_constrains.title: Weak Constrains

strong_constrains.description: Strong run constrains add run_constrains from the build and host env
strong_constrains.title: Strong Constrains

passthrough.description: Environments variables to leak into the build environment from the host system. During build time these variables are recorded and stored in the package output. Use `secrets` for environment variables that should not be recorded.
passthrough.title: Passthrough

env.description: Environment variables to set in the build environment.
env.title: Env

secrets.description: Environment variables to leak into the build environment from the host system that contain sensitve information. Use with care because this might make recipes no longer reproducible on other machines.
secrets.title: Secrets

context.description: Defines arbitrary key-value pairs for Jinja interpolation
context.title: Context

source.description: The source items to be downloaded and used for the build.
source.title: Source

build.description: Describes how the package should be build.

about.description: A human readable description of the package information

extra.description: An set of arbitrary values that are included in the package manifest
extra.title: Extra

patches.description: A list of patches to apply after fetching the source
patches.title: Patches

folder.description: The location in the working directory to place the source
folder.title: Folder

url.description: The url that points to the source. This should be an archive that is extracted in the working directory.
url.title: Url

sha256.description: The SHA256 hash of the source archive
sha256.title: Sha256

md5.description: The MD5 hash of the source archive
md5.title: Md5

file_name.description: A file name to rename the downloaded file (does not apply to archives).
file_name.title: File Name
